description:
Managing the world's oldest Django project

Presented by James Bennett

Or, "how we cut 40,000 lines of code and learned to love unit testing."

This talk will cover some of the development history behind Ellington,
the CMS which spawned the open-source Django web framework, and some of
the issues involved in developing and maintaining a codebase of this age
and size. Highlights include branch management, the advantages of
open-sourcing non- critical functionality, the pain of porting and the
joy that can only be found in a passing test suite.
title: Managing the world's oldest Django project (#80)
